profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: William M. Calder III is a professor of classics and comparative literature at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and an author of numerous books. Calder received his Bachelor's and Master's degrees from Harvard and his Ph.D. from the University of Chicago. Calder has edited or co-edited a bibliography and several volumes of letters of Ulrich von Wilamowitz-Moellendorff, a noted scholar of ancient Greece and its literature.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of William M. Calder, III. Materials include: reprints by Calder and others on Ulrich von Wilamowitz-Moellendorff; photocopies of Wilamowitz correspondence with Max Fr√§nkel and others, some with transcriptions (in German); and correspondence with colleagues, much of it related to Wilamowitz.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
